{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3218460,"name":"","username":"Risingbot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/risingbot/{size}/197105_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-12T02:40:17.961Z","cooked":"

I have been looking at the creation of custom circuit boards. Despite not knowing how they could be used for FIRST, would custom circuit boards/ processors and electrical systems be ok for comp, and are there any specific requirements for having such systems?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-07-12T02:40:17.961Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":395,"readers_count":394,"score":149.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":438858,"topic_slug":"custom-electronics","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57745,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Not so top nerd"},"post_url":"/t/custom-electronics/438858/1","custom_user_title":"Not so top nerd","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3218463,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-12T02:55:07.719Z","cooked":"

As long as your coprocessor does NOT control motors and communicates over legal wired connection (i.e. UART), or through any of the network ports allowed by R704, and does not bypass any safety features of the DS, RIO, or FMS, you’re golden.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-07-12T02:55:07.719Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":389,"readers_count":388,"score":127.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":438858,"topic_slug":"custom-electronics","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/custom-electronics/438858/2","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3218465,"name":"","username":"Risingbot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/risingbot/{size}/197105_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-12T02:57:59.169Z","cooked":"

Just fill me in on what UART and r704 are.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-07-12T02:57:59.169Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":375,"readers_count":374,"score":80.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":438858,"topic_slug":"custom-electronics","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":50684,"username":"crueter","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57745,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Not so top nerd"},"post_url":"/t/custom-electronics/438858/3","custom_user_title":"Not so top nerd","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3218468,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-12T03:01:16.167Z","cooked":"

It also needs to obey the development span rules, just like any other fabricated non COTS component. So fabricated after kickoff, pre-kickoff designs used published before kickoff.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-07-12T03:01:16.167Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":352,"readers_count":351,"score":85.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":438858,"topic_slug":"custom-electronics","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/custom-electronics/438858/4","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3218469,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-12T03:05:36.992Z","cooked":"

As a sample point, we ran 2x of these on our raspberry pi’s on our 2023 robot -

oshwlab.com

PiPOESupply - EasyEDA open source hardware lab

In EasyEDA open source hardware lab, open source square pools all kinds of electrical design engineerings together to realize resource sharing easily.

we ordered prototypes before the season started to verify functionality, released the designs before kickoff, then re-ordered the final design after kickoff and got them delivered before competition.

As far as legality, we went through inspection claiming them under the CUSTOM CIRCUIT rules.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-07-12T03:06:12.416Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":334,"readers_count":333,"score":126.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":438858,"topic_slug":"custom-electronics","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://oshwlab.com/chrisgerth010592/pipoesupply","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"PiPOESupply - EasyEDA open source hardware lab","clicks":20}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/custom-electronics/438858/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3218470,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-12T03:05:38.478Z","cooked":"

UART is a method of communication with the RIO, which can be done through the MXP expansion port (I believe). There are many methods of wired communication with the RIO, like UART, SPI, I2C (which is broken and unusable), and perhaps the most reliable and easy to use being Ethernet. Ethernet allows simple communication over NetworkTables, versus having to deal with direct serial reads from various different ports.

R704 allows the following ports to be used by communication within the RIO-coprocessor-radio-DS ecosystem:

IMG_20230711_230450782×544 80.4 KB

As well as ports 5800-5810, for “team use”.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-07-12T03:05:38.478Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":315,"readers_count":314,"score":88.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":438858,"topic_slug":"custom-electronics","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/d/6/d609b40660e11fdb69d515b6970e43500c6e9f6d.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57745,"username":"Risingbot","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/risingbot/{size}/197105_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/custom-electronics/438858/6","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3218475,"name":"","username":"TAF_International","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/34f0e0/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-07-12T03:23:55.749Z","cooked":"
crueter:

I2C (which is broken and unusable)

I2C is usable with a NAVX or other MXP expansion that adds on a separate I2C port. Only the built in roboRIO port causes the lockup issue

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-07-12T03:23:55.749Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":278,"readers_count":277,"score":60.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":438858,"topic_slug":"custom-electronics","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54117,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/custom-electronics/438858/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3218476,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-12T03:40:13.470Z","cooked":"

From what I’ve heard, teams have had the same or similar issues with the MXP I2C port, no matter how it’s connected.

The general recommendation is pretty much “only use I2C if you’re bridging it from a microprocessor to another communications method like UART or NT”

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-07-12T03:40:13.470Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":264,"readers_count":263,"score":72.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":438858,"topic_slug":"custom-electronics","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":54117,"username":"TAF_International","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/34f0e0/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/custom-electronics/438858/8","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3218479,"name":"","username":"TAF_International","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/34f0e0/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-07-12T04:23:53.390Z","cooked":"

oh interesting, my personal experience with the MXP port has been pretty good, we ran 2 rev color sensors off the port for our ball indexers in 2022 and never had an issues there.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-07-12T04:23:53.390Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":250,"readers_count":249,"score":60.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":438858,"topic_slug":"custom-electronics","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":50684,"username":"crueter","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54117,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/custom-electronics/438858/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3218709,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-13T15:00:12.558Z","cooked":"

All the roboRIOs I’ve tested never locked up on the MXP I2C with one device and always locked up at random times with more than one device (tried various devices).

This has a couple of methods to communicate with the roboRIO OP could use (I2C replacement interface but that part may not be of interest to OP).

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-07-13T15:00:12.558Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":228,"readers_count":227,"score":60.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":438858,"topic_slug":"custom-electronics","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/yearly-overview/known-issues.html#onboard-i2c-causing-system-lockups","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Known Issues — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":54117,"username":"TAF_International","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/34f0e0/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/custom-electronics/438858/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3218714,"name":"marshall","username":"marshall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marshall/{size}/167657_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-13T15:47:51.593Z","cooked":"
TAF_International:

we ran 2 rev color sensors off the port for our ball indexers in 2022 and never had an issues there.

How did you handle overlapping I2C addresses?

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2023-07-13T15:47:51.593Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":61.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":438858,"topic_slug":"custom-electronics","display_username":"marshall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17672,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team Principal"},"post_url":"/t/custom-electronics/438858/11","custom_user_title":"Team Principal","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3218725,"name":"","username":"TAF_International","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/34f0e0/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-07-13T16:49:54.737Z","cooked":"

we had a multiplexer (i believe this one https://www.tindie.com/products/closedcube/tca9548a-i2c-multiplexer-with-jst-ph-20mm-headers ) for the 2 or 3 sensors we had

Thanks for the information. Your successful experience may still be consistent with my test results that one device works and more than one do not work depending on how many devices the roboRIO thinks it’s seeing including the multiplexor. The MXP I2C failures I had were with two or more devices running at the same time and you apparently only had one at a time.
